eg.ui.filetree

Class FileTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • eg.ui.filetree.FileTree

  • public class FileTree
extends java.util.Observable
    The display of a project's file system in a JTree.

      Sets the name of the folder that can be deleted although it is not empty
      void setProjectTree(java.lang.String projRoot)
      Sets the project's root directory and displays the file system at this root if the same root is not aready set
      void updateTree()
      Updates the tree at the currently shown root.

      • setProjectTree

        public void setProjectTree(java.lang.String projRoot)
        Sets the project's root directory and displays the file system at this root if the same root is not aready set
        Parameters:

      • setDeletableDirName

        public void setDeletableDirName(java.lang.String dirName)
        Sets the name of the folder that can be deleted although it is not empty
        Parameters:
        dirName - the name of the directory that can be deleted. Maybe the empty String but not null

      • updateTree

        public void updateTree()
        Updates the tree at the currently shown root. This root may by a subdirectory of the actual project root. Called when it is expected that one or more nodes were removed or added

      • setCloseAct

        public void setCloseAct(java.awt.event.ActionListener al)
        Sets the listener for actions to close the file view
        Parameters:
        al - the ActionListener
